New Records: New Zealand’s first win against Australia in Australia in any format since 2011
Key Match Events: Devon Conway carried his bat on Saturday with a majestic unbeaten 92 to help New Zealand post 200-3
Australia were skittled for 111 in Sydney to make a nightmare start to their title defence
David Warner fell for three in the second over, dragging the ball onto his stumps off Tim Southee
Aaron Finch hit a giant six off Trent Boult but didn’t last much longer
Mitchell Santner and Tim Southee both took three wickets each
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand got their revenge for last year’s T20 WC final loss to Australia
New Zealand register their first win IN Australia!
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match at a sold-out Sydney Cricket Ground was a repeat of the 2021 final in Dubai when Australia powered to an eight-wicket win and their maiden T20 World Cup crown
New Zealand began their World Cup campaign in spectacular fashion
Conway’s knock came off just 58 balls with seven fours and two sixes, joining a select group to make 90 or more at a World Cup
